types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: isoCode
fields.description: ISO 639-1 alpha-2 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes

fields.name: isoCode
fields.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements

types.name: Order
types.description: Just an order

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: Order has been sent but confirmation awaiting

enumValues.name: FULLFILLED
enumValues.description: Order has been fullfilled completely (all positions in delivery)

types.name: Product
types.description: Abstract Product

types.name: ProductAssortmentPath
types.description: Directed assortment to product paths (breadcrumbs)

types.name: Assortment
types.description: Assortment

types.name: AssortmentPath
types.description: Directed assortment to product paths (breadcrumbs)

types.name: AssortmentPathLink
types.description:
A connection that represents an uplink from assortment to assortment,
assortmentId and assortmentTexts are there for convenience
to short-circuit breadcrumb lookups

types.name: SearchResult
types.description: Search result

types.name: ProductSearchResult
types.description: Search result

types.name: Quotation
types.description: Quotation

enumValues.name: REJECTED
enumValues.description: Quotation has been rejected by either party

enumValues.name: FULLFILLED
enumValues.description: Quotation has been used to order the product

types.name: Log
types.description: Server side log entry, that is contextually augmented with user & order

types.name: Subscription
types.description: Subscription

types.name: PlanProduct
types.description: Plan (Subscriptionable virtual Product)

types.name: WorkType
types.description:
This is just a placeholder. Extend WorkType with the active plugins on
startup. See /examples/minimal/boot.js:92

fields.name: started
fields.description: Timestamp when this work was allocated -> Locked for other workers

fields.name: status
fields.description:
Status is derived from the other fields. E.g. Work without `started`
field has status `NEW`

fields.name: error
fields.description: Work can have errors recorded, but nonetheless be marked as `success`

fields.name: scheduled
fields.description: If set, the work will not be allocated before this date

fields.name: original
fields.description: Link to original work: For retries, clones, ...

fields.name: retries
fields.description:
How many times this work should be retried. A retried work is a clone
with `retries = parent.retries - 1` usually. Plugins can implement
different workflows.

fields.name: timeout
fields.description:
If work is `ALLOCATED` longer than `timeout` it is considered as
`FAILED` and could be cleaned.

fields.name: loginWithPassword
fields.description: Log the user in with a password.

fields.name: createUser
fields.description: Create a new user.

fields.name: heartbeat
fields.description:
Update hearbeat (updates user activity information such as last
login and logged in user IP address, locale and country where they
accessed the system)

fields.name: changePassword
fields.description: Change the current user's password. Must be logged in.

fields.name: forgotPassword
fields.description: Request a forgot password email.

fields.name: resetPassword
fields.description: Reset the password for a user using a token received in email. Logs the user in afterwards.

fields.name: logout
fields.description: Log the user out.

fields.name: verifyEmail
fields.description: Marks the user's email address as verified. Logs the user in afterwards.

fields.name: sendVerificationEmail
fields.description: Send an email with a link the user can use verify their email address.

fields.name: loginAsGuest
fields.description: Login as Guest User (creates an anonymous user and returns logged in token)

fields.name: createCart
fields.description:
Creates an alternative cart. If you use this feature, you should use explicit orderId's when using the
cart mutations. Else it will work like a stack and the checkout will use the very first cart of the user.

fields.name: addCartProduct
fields.description: Add a new item to the cart. Order gets generated with status = open (= order before checkout / cart) if necessary.

fields.name: addMultipleCartProducts
fields.description: Add multiple new item to the cart. Order gets generated with status = open (= order before checkout / cart) if necessary.

fields.name: addCartDiscount
fields.description: Add a new discount to the cart, a new order gets generated with status = open (= order before checkout / cart) if necessary

fields.name: addCartQuotation
fields.description: Add a new quotation to the cart.

fields.name: updateCart
fields.description:
Change billing address and order contact of an open order (cart). All of the parameters
except order ID are optional and the update will ocure for parameters provided.
If the delivery provider or payment provider ID provided doesnt already exist new order payment
will be created with the provided ID.

fields.name: emptyCart
fields.description:
Remove all items of an open order (cart) if possible.
if you want to remove single cart item use removeCartItem instead

fields.name: checkoutCart
fields.description:
Process the checkout (automatically charge & deliver if possible), the cart will get
transformed to an ordinary order if everything goes well.

fields.name: updateCartItem
fields.description:
Change the quantity or configuration of an item in an open order.align-baselineAll
of the parameters are optional except item ID and for the parameters provided the
update will be performed accordingly.

fields.name: removeCartItem
fields.description: Remove an item from an open order

fields.name: removeCartDiscount
fields.description: Remove a discount from the cart

fields.name: createSubscription
fields.description: Create a subscription.

fields.name: updateSubscription
fields.description: Update a subscription

fields.name: activateSubscription
fields.description: Activate a subscription by changing the status to ACTIVE

fields.name: terminateSubscription
fields.description: Terminate an actively running subscription by changing it's status to TERMINATED

fields.name: setOrderDeliveryProvider
fields.description:
Change the delivery method/provider to an order. If the delivery provider
doesnt exists new delivery provider will be created with the provided ID.

fields.name: setOrderPaymentProvider
fields.description:
Change the payment method/provider to an order. If the payment provider
doesnt exists new payment provider will be created with the provided ID.

fields.name: updateOrderDeliveryShipping
fields.description: Update a Shipping Delivery Provider's specific configuration

fields.name: updateOrderDeliveryPickUp
fields.description: Update a Pick Up Delivery Provider's specific configuration

fields.name: updateOrderPaymentCard
fields.description: Update a Card Payment Provider's specific configuration

fields.name: updateOrderPaymentInvoice
fields.description: Update an Invoice Payment Provider's specific configuration

fields.name: updateOrderPaymentGeneric
fields.description: Update a Generic Payment Provider's specific configuration

fields.name: removeOrder
fields.description: Remove an order while it's still open

fields.name: confirmOrder
fields.description: Manually confirm an order which is in progress

fields.name: payOrder
fields.description: Manually mark an unpaid/partially paid order as fully paid

fields.name: deliverOrder
fields.description: Manually mark a undelivered order as delivered

fields.name: updateEmail
fields.description: Update E-Mail address of any user or logged in user if userId is not provided

fields.name: addEmail
fields.description: Update E-Mail address of any user or logged in user if userId is not provided

fields.name: removeEmail
fields.description: Update E-Mail address of any user or logged in user if userId is not provided

fields.name: updateUserAvatar
fields.description: Update Avatar of any user or logged in user if userId is not provided

fields.name: setUserTags
fields.description: Set tags of user

fields.name: updateUserProfile
fields.description: Update Profile of any user or logged in user if userId is not provided

fields.name: enrollUser
fields.description: Enroll a new user, setting enroll to true will let the user choose his password (e-mail gets sent)

fields.name: sendEnrollmentEmail
fields.description: Forcefully trigger an enrollment email for already added users by e-mail

fields.name: setUsername
fields.description: Set username for a specific user

fields.name: setPassword
fields.description: Set a new password for a specific user

fields.name: setRoles
fields.description: Set roles of a user

fields.name: createProduct
fields.description: Create a new product

fields.name: publishProduct
fields.description: Make the product visible on any shop listings (product queries)

fields.name: unpublishProduct
fields.description: Hide the product visible from any shop listings (product queries)

fields.name: removeProduct
fields.description: Remove the product completely!

fields.name: updateProduct
fields.description: Modify generic infos of a product (tags for ex.)

fields.name: updateProductCommerce
fields.description: Modify commerce part of a product

fields.name: updateProductSupply
fields.description: Modify delivery part of a product

fields.name: updateProductPlan
fields.description: Modify plan part of a product

fields.name: updateProductWarehousing
fields.description: Modify warehousing part of a product

fields.name: updateProductTexts
fields.description: Modify localized texts part of a product

fields.name: addProductMedia
fields.description: Add a new media to a product's visualization

fields.name: removeProductMedia
fields.description: Remove a media asset from a product's visualization

fields.name: reorderProductMedia
fields.description: Reorder a media asset (first is primary)

fields.name: updateProductMediaTexts
fields.description: Modify localized texts part of a product's media asset

fields.name: removeProductVariation
fields.description: Removes product variation with the provided ID

fields.name: removeProductVariationOption
fields.description: Removes product option value for product variation with the provided variation option value

fields.name: updateProductVariationTexts
fields.description:
Update product variation texts with the specified locales for product variations
that match the provided variation ID and production option value

fields.name: createProductVariation
fields.description: Creates new product variation for a product.

fields.name: createProductBundleItem
fields.description: Adds one product as bundle for another products

fields.name: removeBundleItem
fields.description: Removes products bundle item found at the given 0 based index.

fields.name: createProductVariationOption
fields.description: Adds variation option to an existing product variations

fields.name: addProductAssignment
fields.description:
Link a new product to a ConfigurableProduct by providing a configuration
combination that uniquely identifies a row in the assignment matrix

fields.name: removeProductAssignment
fields.description:
Unlinks a product from a ConfigurableProduct by providing a configuration
combination that uniquely identifies a row in the assignment matrix

fields.name: createLanguage
fields.description: Adds new language along with the user who created it

fields.name: updateLanguage
fields.description: Updates the specified language.

fields.name: removeLanguage
fields.description: Deletes the specified languages

fields.name: updateCountry
fields.description: Updates provided country information

fields.name: removeCountry
fields.description: Deletes the specified country

fields.name: updateCurrency
fields.description: Updates the specified currency

fields.name: removeCurrency
fields.description: Deletes the specified currency

fields.name: createPaymentProvider
fields.description: Adds new payment provider

fields.name: updatePaymentProvider
fields.description: Updates payment provider information with the provided ID

fields.name: removePaymentProvider
fields.description:
Deletes the specified payment provider by setting the deleted filed to current timestamp.
Note the payment provider is still available only its status is deleted

fields.name: createDeliveryProvider
fields.description: Creates new delivery provider

fields.name: updateDeliveryProvider
fields.description: Updates the delivery provider specified

fields.name: removeDeliveryProvider
fields.description:
Deletes a delivery provider by setting the deleted field to current timestamp.
Note the delivery provider still exists.

fields.name: createWarehousingProvider
fields.description: Creates new warehouse provider.

fields.name: updateWarehousingProvider
fields.description: Updates warehousing provider information with the provided ID

fields.name: removeWarehousingProvider
fields.description:
Deletes the specified warehousing provider by setting the deleted filed to current timestamp.
Note warehousing provider still exists in the system after successful
completing of this operation with status deleted.

fields.name: createAssortment
fields.description: Creates new assortment.

fields.name: updateAssortment
fields.description: Updates the provided assortment

fields.name: setBaseAssortment
fields.description:
Makes the assortment provided as the base assortment and make
any other existing base assortment regular assortments.

fields.name: removeAssortment
fields.description: Removes assortment with the provided ID

fields.name: updateAssortmentTexts
fields.description: Modify localized texts part of an assortment

fields.name: addAssortmentProduct
fields.description: Add a new product to an assortment

fields.name: removeAssortmentProduct
fields.description: Remove a product from an assortment

fields.name: reorderAssortmentProducts
fields.description: Reorder the products in an assortment

fields.name: addAssortmentLink
fields.description: Add a new child assortment to an assortment

fields.name: removeAssortmentLink
fields.description: Remove a child/parent assortment link from it's parent

fields.name: reorderAssortmentLinks
fields.description: Reorder the child assortment links in it's parent

fields.name: addAssortmentFilter
fields.description: Add a new filter to an assortment

fields.name: removeAssortmentFilter
fields.description: Remove a product from an assortment

fields.name: reorderAssortmentFilters
fields.description: Reorder the products in an assortment

fields.name: createFilter
fields.description: Creates new Filter along with the user who created it.

fields.name: updateFilter
fields.description: Updates the specified filter with the information passed.

fields.name: removeFilter
fields.description: Deletes the specified filter

fields.name: removeFilterOption
fields.description: Removes the filter option from the specified filter.

fields.name: updateFilterTexts
fields.description: Updates or created specified filter texts for filter with ID provided and locale and optionally filterOptionValue

fields.name: createFilterOption
fields.description: Adds new option to filters

fields.name: createProductReview
fields.description: Add a new ProductReview

fields.name: updateProductReview
fields.description: Update an existing ProductReview. The logic to allow/dissallow editing is controlled by product plugin logic

fields.name: removeProductReview
fields.description: Remove an existing ProductReview. The logic to allow/dissallow removal is controlled by product plugin logic

fields.name: addProductReviewVote
fields.description:
Add a vote to a ProductReview.
If there there is a previous vote from the user invoking this it will be removed and updated with the new vote

fields.name: removeProductReviewVote
fields.description: Remove a vote from a ProductReview

fields.name: requestQuotation
fields.description: Request for Proposal (RFP) for the specified product

fields.name: verifyQuotation
fields.description: Verify quotation request elligibility. and marks requested quotations as verified if it is

fields.name: rejectQuotation
fields.description: Reject an RFP, this is possible as long as a quotation is not fullfilled

fields.name: makeQuotationProposal
fields.description: Make a proposal as answer to the RFP by changing its status to PROCESSED

fields.name: bookmark
fields.description: toggle Bookmarks state of a product as currently logged in user

fields.name: createBookmark
fields.description: Create a bookmark for a specific user

fields.name: removeBookmark
fields.description: Remove an existing bookmark by ID

fields.name: addWork
fields.description: Add work to the work queue. Each type has its own input shape

fields.name: allocateWork
fields.description:
Get the next task from the worker queue. This will also mark the task as "started".
Optional worker to identify the worker.

fields.name: doWork
fields.description: Trigger a registered plugin for "type" to actually do the work with given "input".

fields.name: finishWork
fields.description:
Register a work attempt manually.

Note: Usually, work attempts are handled internally by the inbuilt cron
worker. This mutation is part of the interface for "outside" workers.

fields.name: removeWork
fields.description: Manually remove a work

fields.name: registerPaymentCredentials
fields.description:
Register credentials for an existing payment provider allowing to store and use them
for later payments (1-click checkout or subscriptions)

fields.name: markPaymentCredentialsPreferred
fields.description: Make's the provided payment credential as the users preferred method of payment.

fields.name: removePaymentCredentials
fields.description: Deletes the specified payment credential.

fields.name: signPaymentProviderForCredentialRegistration
fields.description: Sign a generic payment provider for registration

fields.name: signPaymentProviderForCheckout
fields.description: Sign a generic order payment

types.name: HashedPasswordInput

inputFields.name: algorithm
inputFields.description: Algorithm used to hash the password

types.name: LoginMethodResponse
types.description: Type returned when the user logs in

fields.description: Id of the user logged in user

fields.name: token
fields.description: Token of the connection

fields.name: tokenExpires
fields.description: Expiration date for the token

fields.name: user
fields.description: The logged in user

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: sign
fields.description: Sign a transaction with the provider

types.name: Upload
types.description: The `Upload` scalar type represents a file upload.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: ProductVariationAssignmentVector
types.description: Key Value Combination

types.name: ProductVariationAssignment
types.description: Key Value Combination to Product Assignment

fields.name: vectors
fields.description: Query string key=val&key=val ...

fields.name: product
fields.description: Assigned Product

types.name: ConfigurableProduct
types.description: Configurable Product (Proxy)

fields.name: products
fields.description: Reduced list of possible products by key/value combinations

fields.name: variations
fields.description: Product's variations (keys) and their options (values)

fields.name: assignments
fields.description: Complete assignment matrix

types.name: SimpleProduct
types.description: Simple Product

types.name: BundleProduct
types.description: A Bundle product consists of multiple configured products

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
